Dear Ms. McNutt:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 08/24/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Linda Tansil, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4146 Immunizations.
(1) A resident shall have current immunizations as
required by the department of community health.
Two of three treatment program youths did not have current immunizations. A
youth's Meningococcal B Category B was overdue on 04/16/2023. Another
youth's Meningococcal B Category B was overdue on 11/10/2021 and his
Meningococal Conjugate was overdue on 10/10/2022.

CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter
care institutions; initial treatment plan.
(5) The social service supervisor shall approve,
countersign, and date the initial treatment plan.
Three of three treatment program youths’ initial treatment plans were not
approved, countersign and dated by the social service supervisor.
CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
staff qualifications.
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall
not permit a child caring institution staff member to
begin working unless all of the following has been
completed using the forms, and in the manner,
prescribed by the department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R
400.4113(f), including a fingerprintbased check of
national crime information databases, unless an
alternative criminal history check has been approved by
the federal government.
One of seven new employee files reviewed did not have a criminal history check
completed prior to employment. Staff person was hired on 03/26/2023 and
criminal history clearance was completed on 08/18/2023.
CCI Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and
volunteers.
(1) The licensee shall document, prior to employment,
that each employee and volunteer who has contact with
residents 4 or more hours per week for more than 2
consecutive weeks is free from communicable
tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable tuberculosis
shall be verified within the 1 year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the
last verification or prior to the expiration of the current
verification.
Three of seven new employee files reviewed did not have their Tuberculosis
screening completed prior to employment. A staff person was hired on
06/27/2023 and her Tuberculosis screening was completed on 08/22/2023. A
staff person was hired on 03/26/2023 and her Tuberculosis screening was

completed on 08/18/2023. A staff person was hired on 02/05/2023 and her
Tuberculosis screening was completed on 02/24/2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Discussed staff training hours and documentation are by calendar year.
Training documentation is to include the name of the training, date of the
training, and hours of training.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Add a line on treatment plans to prompt the social service supervisor to review,
sign and date after approval.
• Discussed possible future plans of relocating The Sanctuary from Royal Oak,
MI to Pontiac, MI.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The Sanctuary is fiscally sound based on Lighthouse 2021/2022 Fiscal year
financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief administrator assessment was completed on 08/07/2023 by the interim chief
administrator. Department of Child Welfare Licensing approved interim chief
administrator for chief administrator position on 08/23/2023. The assessment
states quarterly fire drills will occur and be documented. The assessment states

the process of documenting staff tuberculosis tests and staff training will be
revised.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff was interviewed on 08/09/2023. Staff stated the transition from The
Sanctuary - Common Ground to The Sanctuary - Lighthouse was smooth. Staff did
not express concerns or training needs.
Youths were interviewed on 08/09/2023. Youths explained the program and did
not express concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of The Sanctuary was completed on 08/09/2023. The agency was
clean and orderly. There are no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
